de.javasoft.swing.jytable
Class JYTableColumnExt

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.table.TableColumn
      org.jdesktop.swingx.table.TableColumnExt
          de.javasoft.swing.jytable.JYTableColumnExt
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, org.jdesktop.swingx.plaf.UIDependent
public class JYTableColumnExt
extends org.jdesktop.swingx.table.TableColumnExt

JYTableColumnExt with enhanced functionality.

Features

  • has a filterable property which allows to include/exclude the column to/from the table's filter row
  • a columnFilterFactory property which allows to customize with per-column filter factories.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Creates new table view column with the specified model index and column width.

JYTableColumnExt

public JYTableColumnExt(int modelIndex,
                        int width,
                        javax.swing.table.TableCellRenderer cellRenderer,
                        javax.swing.table.TableCellEditor cellEditor)
Creates new table view column with the specified model index, column width, cell renderer and cell editor.

Parameters:
modelIndex - index of table model column to which this view column is bound.
width - pixel width of view column
cellRenderer - the cell renderer which will render all cells in this view column
cellEditor - the cell editor which will edit cells in this view column

Method Detail

isFilterable

public boolean isFilterable()
Returns the filterable property.

Returns:
the filterable property.
See Also:
setFilterable(boolean)

setFilterable

public void setFilterable(boolean filterable)
Sets the filterable property. If true, a FilterRowController creates and maintains a filter input component for this column.

The default value is true.

Parameters:
filterable - the filterable property
See Also:
isFilterable()

getColumnFilterFactory

public IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> getColumnFilterFactory()
Returns the ColumnFilterFactory which should be used to create an appropriate ColumnFilter for this column. May be null to denote that the default should be used.

Returns:
a factory to be used for creating a column filter for this column or null if the default should be used
See Also:
setColumnFilterFactory(IColumnFilterFactory)

setColumnFilterFactory

public void setColumnFilterFactory(IColumnFilterFactory<? extends javax.swing.table.TableModel> factory)
Sets the ColumnFilterFactory for this column. May be null to denote usage of default.

The default value is null.

Parameters:
factory - the ColumnFilterFactory to use.
See Also:
getColumnFilterFactory(), IColumnFilterFactory
